page.title: 11CHANGES SINCE WORLD WAR 2.
page.content: {Mrs. J. Wheildon of Mill Cottage Butlers Marston has written of these recollections: "I came to the district as a land girl in 1941.I lodged at Little Kineton and travelled every day on my bicycle to Morelands farm in the parish of Butlers Marston.There I learnt to milk by hand,look after suckled calves,feed pigs and help with hay-making and harvest.Hay-making meant taking hay to ricks,and harvesting was "stooking" the corn,carrying again to a rick and helping to build it,a craftsman's job, and hard work in the heat of summer.The farm workers were craftsmen each with his own speciality - -horseman,hedge-cutter,cowman, shepherd,but all helped at harvest time.The workers came to work on bikes,or walked each day across fields."
